contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "earth" and "heaven" form a merism that refer to the sky. It is implicit that the two women flew away with the basket. Alternate translation: "They lifted the basket up into the sky and flew away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: They lifted up the basket between earth and heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) this is a poetic way of expressing specific countries to which the people were exiled. Alternate translation: "From the land to the east and from the land to the west" or 2) this is a merism that means from all directions. Alternate translation: "from all lands in every direction" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: from the land of the sunrise and from the land of the setting sun

contextId.occurrenceNote: This merism refers to all of life's activities everywhere that anyone went. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
Here "right" and "left" represent every direction. Alternate translation: "in every direction" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: on their right and on their left
